options.content:
These are basic facts that can be useful for understanding what's happening on chain right now.

Follow the sections below this to examine the three major focus areas of the storage system health.

targets.expr: sort_desc(quantile by (pruner_name, tag) (0.8, velor_pruner_versions{chain_name=~"$chain_name", cluster=~"$cluster", metrics_source=~"$metrics_source", namespace=~"$namespace", kubernetes_pod_name=~"$kubernetes_pod_name", role=~"$role", tag="min_readable"}))

sort_desc(rate(velor_storage_latest_transaction_version{chain_name=~"$chain_name", cluster=~"$cluster", metrics_source=~"$metrics_source", namespace=~"$namespace", kubernetes_pod_name=~"$kubernetes_pod_name", role=~"$role"}[1m]) / on (kubernetes_pod_name, run_uuid) rate(velor_storage_api_latency_seconds_count{api_name="save_transactions", result="Ok", role=~"$role"}[1m]) < 10000)

quantile(0.5, rate(velor_storage_latest_transaction_version{chain_name=~"$chain_name", cluster=~"$cluster", metrics_source=~"$metrics_source", namespace=~"$namespace", kubernetes_pod_name=~"$kubernetes_pod_name", role=~"$role"}[1m]) / on (kubernetes_pod_name, run_uuid) rate(velor_storage_api_latency_seconds_count{api_name="save_transactions", role=~"$role", result="Ok"}[1m]) < 10000)

options.content:
We expect nodes to have more than 200GB free space all the time.

Identify outliers on the left and filter by peer name to see it's specific values on the other panels. Otherwise you are seeing average values.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT timestamp, epoch,
CAST(JSON_VALUE(json_data, '$.per_byte_read') AS INT64) as per_byte_read,
CAST(JSON_VALUE(json_data, '$.per_item_read') AS INT64) as per_item_read,
CAST(JSON_VALUE(json_data, '$.per_byte_write') AS INT64) as per_byte_write,
CAST(JSON_VALUE(json_data, '$.per_item_write') AS INT64) as per_item_write,
CAST(JSON_VALUE(json_data, '$.per_byte_create') AS INT64) as per_byte_create,
CAST(JSON_VALUE(json_data, '$.per_item_create') AS INT64) as per_item_create,
FROM `analytics-test-345723.indexer_mainnet_gcp.block_metadata_transactions` JOIN (
  SELECT json_data, transaction_version FROM `analytics-test-345723.indexer_mainnet_gcp.move_resources_view`
  WHERE name = "StorageGas"
) on version = transaction_version
WHERE timestamp between TIMESTAMP_MILLIS($__from) and TIMESTAMP_MILLIS($__to)

panels.title: latest total number of state items (p80)

targets.expr: quantile(0.8, velor_storage_total_state_bytes{chain_name=~"$chain_name", cluster=~"$cluster", metrics_source=~"$metrics_source", namespace=~"$namespace", kubernetes_pod_name=~"$kubernetes_pod_name", role=~"$role"} / velor_storage_state_items)

targets.legendFormat: state bytes created in the past hour

targets.expr: max(velor_storage_latest_transaction_version{chain_name=~"$chain_name", cluster=~"$cluster", metrics_source=~"$metrics_source", namespace=~"$namespace", kubernetes_pod_name=~"$kubernetes_pod_name", role=~"$role"}) - ignoring(pruner_name) quantile by (pruner_name) (0.8, velor_pruner_min_readable_version{chain_name=~"$chain_name", cluster=~"$cluster", metrics_source=~"$metrics_source", namespace=~"$namespace", kubernetes_pod_name=~"$kubernetes_pod_name", role=~"$role", pruner_name="ledger_pruner"})

panels.description: Free disk space on the DB volume. Less than a few GiBs, it's a problem.

targets.expr: kubelet_volume_stats_capacity_bytes{chain_name=~"$chain_name", cluster=~"$cluster", metrics_source=~"$metrics_source", namespace=~"$namespace", kubernetes_pod_name=~"$kubernetes_pod_name", persistentvolumeclaim!~".*prometheus.*", role=~"$role"} - kubelet_volume_stats_used_bytes

sort_desc(node_disk_available_space{chain_name=~"$chain_name", cluster=~"$cluster", metrics_source=~"$metrics_source", namespace=~"$namespace", kubernetes_pod_name=~"$kubernetes_pod_name",  persistentvolumeclaim!~".*prometheus.*", type!="rootfs", name!="overlay", role=~"$role"})

panels.title: Free Disk Space

options.content:
# Are we the bottleneck?

These graphs show how much time was spent in execution/commit stages.
**If any of them is close to 1 second, that pipeline stage might be the current bottlenect in the system.**
To further understand the bottleneck, go to "Storage Details" dashboard.

Note: These numbers are measured on the block_executor/chunk_executor side. It's not a bad idea to cross check these numbers with the numbers measured in consensus/state_sync side. If the numbers don't match, it might be an indication of a scheduling issue.

Other things to look at if these stages are slow:
- IOPS
- CPU usage
- API latencies
- Number of txns per save (block size and/or chunk size)

panels.title: Time Spent in Execution per Second (consensus)
Time Spent in Commit per Second (consensus)
Time Spent in Execution/Apply per Second (state sync)
Time Spent in Commit per Second (state sync)

options.content:
# Disk IO

For markdown syntax help: [commonmark.org/help](https://commonmark.org/help/)

targets.expr: sum by (kubernetes_pod_name, run_uuid) (rate(velor_schemadb_batch_commit_bytes_sum{chain_name=~"$chain_name", cluster=~"$cluster", metrics_source=~"$metrics_source", namespace=~"$namespace", kubernetes_pod_name=~"$kubernetes_pod_name", role=~"$role", db_name=~"$db_name"}[1m]))

sort_desc(quantile by (pruner_name) (0.8, velor_pruner_min_readable_version{chain_name=~"$chain_name", cluster=~"$cluster", metrics_source=~"$metrics_source", namespace=~"$namespace", kubernetes_pod_name=~"$kubernetes_pod_name", role=~"$role", pruner_name !="state_store"}))

panels.description:
This reflects the IO performance of the underlying device.

Expect single or double digits of microseconds.

targets.expr: sum by (kubernetes_pod_name, run_uuid) (irate(velor_schemadb_get_latency_seconds_sum{chain_name=~"$chain_name", cluster=~"$cluster", metrics_source=~"$metrics_source", namespace=~"$namespace", kubernetes_pod_name=~"$kubernetes_pod_name", role=~"$role"}[1m])) / sum by (kubernetes_pod_name, run_uuid) (irate(velor_schemadb_get_latency_seconds_count[1m]))

panels.title: SchemaDB get() latency

sum by (kubernetes_pod_name) (irate(velor_storage_api_latency_seconds_count{chain_name=~"$chain_name", cluster=~"$cluster", metrics_source=~"$metrics_source", namespace=~"$namespace", kubernetes_pod_name=~"$kubernetes_pod_name", role=~"$role", result="Ok"}[1m])) / sum by (kubernetes_pod_name) (irate(velor_storage_api_latency_seconds_count{chain_name=~"$chain_name", cluster=~"$cluster", metrics_source=~"$metrics_source", namespace=~"$namespace", kubernetes_pod_name=~"$kubernetes_pod_name", role=~"$role"}[1m]))

panels.description: This panel should show "No data" when there is no error.

targets.expr: sum by (kubernetes_pod_name) (irate(velor_storage_api_latency_seconds_count{chain_name=~"$chain_name", cluster=~"$cluster", metrics_source=~"$metrics_source", namespace=~"$namespace", kubernetes_pod_name=~"$kubernetes_pod_name", role=~"$role", result="Err"}[1m]))

panels.title: # of Errors
